title: EventLoop::new() can panic with "Bad File Descriptor"
body:
We are using Alacritty at Zed to provide the embedded terminal, and across the whole userbase see this panic a few times a day:

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'create mio Poll: Os { code: 9, kind: Uncategorized, message: "Bad file descriptor" }'
/Users/administrator/.cargo/git/checkouts/alacritty-afea874b09a502a5/3330614/alacritty_terminal/src/event_loop.rs:163
<terminal::TerminalBuilder>::new
<project::Project>::create_terminal
// more zed stuff....
```

Although we have struggled to reproduce this problem in situ, we suspect this happens while the filesystem is quite heavily loaded (we're restoring a workspace for example https://github.com/zed-industries/zed/issues/6835). That said, this is not reliably reproducible for those users.

I think the best next step is relatively straightforward, which is to pass the result out of `EventLoop::new()` instead of unwrapping, so that the caller can handle it.

### System

OS: macOS
Version: [Zed](https://zed.dev) using alacritty_terminal v0.21

### Logs

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'create mio Poll: Os { code: 9, kind: Uncategorized, message: "Bad file descriptor" }'
/Users/administrator/.cargo/git/checkouts/alacritty-afea874b09a502a5/3330614/alacritty_terminal/src/event_loop.rs:163
<terminal::TerminalBuilder>::new
<project::Project>::create_terminal
// more zed stuff....
```
